resources.string: No Permissions to write to %1$s %2$s. (Is there sdcard-hardware and is the sdcard mounted?)
No Permissions to write to current zip \'%1$s\'. Do you want to use default \'%2$s\' instead?

" ToGoZip - Add to Zip for android's 'share'/'send to' menu:
Easy collection of files from every supporting app into one zip-file while beeing 'on the go' or offline.

This collecting 2go.zip-file is like a suitcase where you can put things (files) into from nearly everywhere (from every app that supports 'share'/'send to') and that can travel  everywhere (via email, bluetooth, nfc).

The program's author uses ToGoZip to collect new android calendar entries (ics-files)  that should be transfered to the desctop-pcs-s calendar.

"

ToGoZip
Version $versionName$
$about$

History

Improvements v0.1.2.20141111
  • Added Settings Activity to define zip-file.
  • Added this About-Box in Settings.

Improvements v0.1.1.20141109
  • Created share handler for Add To Zip without a gui.
  • Hardcoded zipfile /sdcard/copy/2go.zip.
  • Implemented view/send/sendto/send_multible for file and folder.
  • slf4j-android support.
  • .
  • .
  • Android independant zip enginge
    • Create folder/zip if it does not exist yet.
    • Rename file in zip if already exists.
    • slf4j support.
    • With j2se Unit- and Integration-Tests.

Links

  • Source code of current version of ToGoZip at git repository@github.com
    https://github.com/k3b/ToGoZip/
  • slf4j logging driver for android eu.lp0.slf4j:slf4j-android
    https://github.com/lp0/slf4j-android
  • slf4j logging for java org.slf4j:slf4j-api
    http://www.slf4j.org/
  • junit Testing support junit:junit
    http://junit.org/
  • powermock-mockito Testing support powermock-api-mockito
    https://code.google.com/p/powermock/
    https://github.com/mockito/mockito
